means: <英澳·非正>把…说得一钱不值，贬损…

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均含"废话，胡说"之意。
means: nonsense ： 指因愚蠢或无知而出现的一切荒唐和无意义的言语。
rubbish ： 从本义垃圾引申而指毫无价值的话或思想。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"废物，垃圾"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: waste, garbage, rubbish, litter, debris, junk
means: waste ： 普通用词，概念广泛，指任何被丢弃的东西。
garbage ： 主要指有机废料，包括厨房的剩菜剩饭或不能再用的食物。也可作引申用。
rubbish ： 普通用词，指任何成堆的、破损的、用过的或无用的东西，尤指弃掉的垃圾堆。也可作引申用。
litter ： 是四下乱丢物品的总称，尤指散落于地，有碍观瞻的废物。
debris ： 着重指分解、分裂或破坏后剩下的碎片，也指零散的普通废品。
junk ： 指回收的旧汽车或大型机器，也指毫无实用价值，或破烂物体，但不指垃圾。

sentence.Network_en: I don't know why he bothers me with this kind of rubbish.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不明白他为何用这种烂事来烦我。

sentence.Network_en: They depend on the goodwill of visitors to pick up rubbish.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们相信游客会自觉捡起垃圾。

sentence.Network_en: It's all rubbish and superstition, and there's nothing in it.
sentence.Network_cn: 这都是废话和迷信,不是真的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French rubbous; perhaps related to Old French robe 'spoils'; compare with rubble. The change in the ending was due to association with -ish. The verb (1950s) was originally Australian and New Zealand slang

entry.def: Rubbish consists of unwanted things or waste material such as used paper, empty tins and bottles, and waste food.

example.ex: They had piled most of their rubbish into yellow skips.
example.tran: 他们把大多数的垃圾堆到了黄色的废料桶里。

entry.def: If you think that something is of very poor quality, you can say that it is rubbish .

example.ex: He described her book as absolute rubbish.

entry.def: If you think that an idea or a statement is foolish or wrong, you can say that it is rubbish .

example.ex: These reports are total and utter rubbish.

entry.tran: 极不擅长的;非常差劲的
entry.def: If you think that someone is not very good at something, you can say that they are rubbish at it.

example.ex: He was rubbish at his job...
example.tran: 他的工作做得差劲极了。

example.ex: I tried playing golf, but I was rubbish.
example.tran: 我试过打高尔夫球，但是我的球技太烂了。

entry.tran: 贬低;诋毁;将…说得一文不值
entry.def: If you rubbish a person, their ideas or their work, you say they are of little value.

example.ex: Five whole pages of script were devoted to rubbishing her political opponents...
example.tran: 整整5页讲稿都是对她的政敌的诋毁。

example.ex: Officials have simply rubbished all positive ideas.
example.tran: 官员们对所有的正面意见一律否决。

means.word_mean: 1. worthless material that is to be disposed of

sentences.en: There is a pile of rubbish in the corner of the street.
sentences.cn: 在街道的拐角处有一堆垃圾。

〈英澳·非正〉把…说得一钱不值; 贬损…

sentences.en: The book was rubbished by them.
sentences.cn: 这本书被他们贬得一无是处。

jushi.chinese: 他写的文章都是乱七八糟的东西。

jushi.english: The rubbish should be thrown into the dustbin.
jushi.chinese: 这些垃圾应抛进垃圾箱里去。

jushi.english: That new TV show is absolute rubbish.
jushi.chinese: 那新的电视节目一点儿价值都没有。
